p:
Temper embrittlement is usually attributed to grain boundary segregation of impurity elements
28, 29 . The elemental concentration at the grain boundaries in samples cooled at 60 °C/min (martensitic) and 4.4 °C/min (bainitic) after the step-cooling heat treatment was determined via AES of the fracture surface of two specimens. Figure 11 reveals the segregation of O, C, and S.
